Package eutros.multiblocktweaker.crafttweaker.construction

Class MultiblockBuilder

java.lang.Object
eutros.multiblocktweaker.crafttweaker.construction.MultiblockBuilder
public class MultiblockBuilder extends Object
The Builder, or Multiblock Builder, is used to define a custom CustomMultiblock.

To get started, call start(String, int).

ZenClass:
mods.gregtech.multiblock.Builder

  • Method Details

    • start

      public static MultiblockBuilder start(@NotNull @NotNull String location, int metaId)
      Create a multiblock builder from a resource location.
      Parameters:
      location - The resource location of the multiblock. Used for getting the recipe map again. If no namespace is defined, it defaults to this mod's mod id.
      metaId - The metadata the resulting multiblock will be registered as.
      Returns:
      A multiblock builder instance, that should be used to set the properties of the multiblock.

    • withPattern

      public MultiblockBuilder withPattern(@NotNull @NotNull IBlockPattern pattern)
      Compulsory, set the pattern for the multiblock.
      Parameters:
      pattern - An IBlockPattern defining the multiblock's construction.
      Returns:
      This builder, for convenience.

    • withRecipeMap

      public MultiblockBuilder withRecipeMap(@NotNull @NotNull gregtech.api.recipes.RecipeMap<?> map)
      Compulsory, set the recipe map for the multiblock.
      Parameters:
      map - The map to use.
      Returns:
      This builder, for convenience.

    • withTexture

      public MultiblockBuilder withTexture(@NotNull @NotNull IICubeRenderer texture)
      Set the texture for the multiblock. This will be used for the controller, and all the inputs/outputs when the structure forms.

      If this is not defined, it will be defined as the most common block out of all designs. If there are no designs defined either, build() will fail.

      Parameters:
      texture - The texture to use.
      Returns:
      This builder, for convenience.

    • withZoom

      public MultiblockBuilder withZoom(float zoom)
      Set the default zoom level for the multiblock. This is optional, and if not defined will default to 1.0f
      Parameters:
      zoom - The default zoom level of the multiblock on the JEI preview page
      Returns:
      This builder, for convenience.

    • withPartTooltip

      public MultiblockBuilder withPartTooltip(crafttweaker.api.item.IItemStack itemStack, crafttweaker.api.text.ITextComponent tooltip)
      Add a tooltip to a specific ItemStack in a Multiblock Structure. Multiple tooltips can be added to the same ItemStack. This is optional, and if not defined will not add any tooltips.
      Parameters:
      itemStack - - The ItemStack form of the block to add the tooltip to.
      tooltip - - The localization key for the tooltip to be added.
      Returns:
      This builder, for convenience.

    • clearTooltips

      public MultiblockBuilder clearTooltips(boolean clear)
      A Helper method to clear pre-existing tooltips from Multiblocks. This is optional, and if not called will default false.
      Parameters:
      clear - - If existing tooltips should be cleared.
      Returns:
      This builder, for convenience.

    • addDesign

      public MultiblockBuilder addDesign(@NotNull @NotNull IMultiblockShapeInfo... designs)
      Add a design to be shown in JEI or structure previews. Can be called multiple times.

      If none are defined, the multiblock won't show in JEI.

      Parameters:
      designs - The designs to add and show in JEI.
      Returns:
      This builder, for convenience.

    • build

      @Nullable public CustomMultiblock build()
      Construct the CustomMultiblock using the defined features.

      Will fail if withPattern(IBlockPattern) or withRecipeMap(RecipeMap) wasn't called, or if neither withTexture(IICubeRenderer) nor addDesign(IMultiblockShapeInfo...) was called.

      Returns:
      The built CustomMultiblock.

    • buildAndRegister

      @Nullable public CustomMultiblock buildAndRegister()
      Convenience method, equivalent to build().register()

      Returns:
      The built CustomMultiblock.
      See Also:
      • build()
      • CustomMultiblock.register()
